author: jochembrouwer
content: Since 1559 will raise mainnet gas limit to 30M and the base fee starts at 1e9, we can be rather sure that the first X blocks on mainnet are going to be ~100% full. Are we sure we can handle this sudden 2x gas limit bump?

author: jochembrouwer
content: Does 1559 override the min gas limit check of 5k?

author: jochembrouwer
jochembrouwer
content: This seems to match the spec but I'm rather sure that the spec does not intend to override the min gas limit.

author: sky.cactus
content: Yes.  All testing of 1559 with super duper big blocks went well.

author: sky.cactus
content: What gas limit check are you referring to?

author: jochembrouwer
content: The 5k min gas limit from the yellow paper

author: jochembrouwer
content: I'll find where it's in the YP

author: jochembrouwer
content: Page 7 def (47)

author: jochembrouwer
content: If we would let gas limit go below 1024 (which is practically not possible of course) then the gas limit would be stuck.

author: jochembrouwer
content: According to current rules

author: lightclient
content: No it doesnâ€™t AFAIK

author: jochembrouwer
content: Not sure what you mean here. Do we delete the min 5k gas limit rule or do we keep it?

author: lightclient
content: It should be kept

content: aleut down?

author: sky.cactus
content: Ah, I didn't even know about that lower limit.  Yeah, removing it wasn't intentional.  A PR to update the spec to be more clear would probably be valuable.

author: sky.cactus
content: And another example of why core EIPs should be PRs against an actual spec document.  ðŸ˜„
